sect2.title: Introduction to GNOME Netstatus
sect2.para: The GNOME Netstatus package contains a panel applet that monitors network interfaces. It provides indicators for ingoing and outgoing data, packets received and transmitted, and information about the network interface such as IP information and Ethernet address.

sect2.title: Installation of GNOME Netstatus
sect2.para: Install GNOME Netstatus by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=`pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0` \ --libexecdir=`pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0`/sbin \ --sysconfdir=/etc/gnome --localstatedir=/var/lib && make && make install && chmod 644 `pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0`\ /share/gnome/help/gnome-netstatus/C/*.xml

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --libexecdir=`pkg-config --variable=prefix ORBit-2.0`/sbin: This switch puts libexec files in $GNOME_PREFIX/sbin instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/libexec.
--sysconfdir=/etc/gnome: This switch puts configuration files in /etc/gnome instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/etc.
--localstatedir=/var/lib: This switch puts ScrollKeeper files in /var/lib/scrollkeeper instead of $GNOME_PREFIX/var/scrollkeeper.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The GNOME Netstatus package contains gnome-netstatus-applet.

sect3.title: gnome-netstatus-applet
sect3.para: gnome-netstatus-applet displays information about a network interface on your panel.
